intro.description: This cheat sheet lists all the file types supported by EclipseZX, and describes what each is used for.

item.title: BAS - Boriels ZX Basic Program (*.bas)
item.description: Source code written in Boriels ZX Basic, compiled or interpreted in the IDE.

item.title: ASM - Boriels ZX Assembler (*.asn)
item.description: Source code written in Boriels ZX Assemble, compiled or interpreted in the IDE.

item.title: PAL - ZX Next 256 Color Palette (*.pal)
item.description: Used with sprites (*.spr, *.sp4 etc) and tilemaps. This palette type does not support transparency.

item.title: NPL - ZX Next 256+1 Color Palette (*.npl)
item.description: Used with sprites (*.spr, *.sp4 etc) and tilemaps. This palette type supports a single transparency index or mask.

item.title: AFB - AY Effects Bank (*.afb)
item.description: Container file holding a collection of AFX sound effects.

item.title: AFX - AY Sound Effect (*.afx)
item.description: Individual sound effect data, typically edited in the AY Sound Editor.

item.title: SPR - 8-bit Sprite File (*.spr)
item.description: For 8-Bit 16x16 sprites compatible with the ZX Next.

item.title: SP4 - 4-bit Sprite File (*.sp4)
item.description: For 4-Bit 16x16 sprites compatible with the ZX Next.

item.title: UDG - 1-bit Sprite File (*.udg)
item.description: For 1-Bit 8x8 sprites compatible with all ZX Spectrums.

item.title: CH - 1-bit Character Set File (*.udg)
item.description: For 1-Bit 8x8 characters compatible with all ZX Spectrums.

item.title: TIL - Tile Map (*.til)
item.description: Tile layout used for level or background definition.

item.title: CHR - Character Set (*.chr)
item.description: Custom character definitions for UDGs or fonts.
